message_1: If p represents the statement "I will study for three hours every day" and q represents the statement "I will get an A on the exam if I study for three hours every day," write the logical expression for the compound statement "I will get an A on the exam if and only if I study for three hours every day."
message_2:
The compound statement "I will get an A on the exam if and only if I study for three hours every day" can be written as a logical expression using the biconditional operator, which is represented by the symbol "↔". The biconditional operator means that both p → q (if p, then q) and q → p (if q, then p) are true. So, the logical expression for the given compound statement is:

p ↔ q
